bug.short_desc: quassel does not ship AppData file(s)

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:
We don't have an AppData file, by not shipping it people looking for quassel in Gnome Software will not be able to find it. Someone in #quassel was momentarily confused they could not find the Fedora package.
Looking at quassel's changelog, it seems we briefly did have one but:
* Wed Sep 16 2015 Richard Hughes <rhughes@redhat.com> - 0.12.2-2 - Remove the AppData file as the desktop file is no longer valid.
[...]
* Thu Mar 26 2015 Richard Hughes <rhughes@redhat.com> - 0.11.0-3 - Add an AppData file for the software center
So, the desktop file may also need fixing.
I can and probably will fix this myself, at some point, but I'm filing a bug for bookkeeping purposes.
We should probably ship a quassel and quassel-client appdata file so both graphical applications are visible.
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): 0.12.2-2 and up.
How reproducible: Always.
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Attempt to find quassel in Gnome Software. 2. 3.
Actual results:
As a graphical application, quassel and quassel-client should appear in Gnome Software.
Expected results:
They don't, because there's no AppData file.
Additional info:
I have filed an upstream bug about this: http://bugs.quassel-irc.org/issues/1400. Ideally, once we fix it downstream, we can send them a pull request with the appdata file(s) included.
I've written AppData files for Quassel and proposed them for review upstream: https://github.com/quassel/quassel/pull/216; after getting some feedback I will incorporate them into the Fedora package.
This bug appears to have been reported against 'rawhide' during the Fedora 25 development cycle. Changing version to '25'.
